selected_quotes: Samsung Nanotech Breakthrough Nearly Doubles Li-Ion Battery Capacity
Samsung Nanotech Breakthrough Nearly Doubles Li-Ion Battery Capacity via /r/science
@leolaporte #TWIT topic? Silicon carbide-free graphene growth on silicon for lithium-ion battery with high volumetric
@drkiki show topic? Silicon carbide-free graphene growth on silicon 4 lithium-ion batt w/hi volumetric energy density

citation.abstract: Silicon is receiving discernable attention as an active material for next generation lithium-ion battery anodes because of its unparalleled gravimetric capacity. However, the large volume change of silicon over charge-discharge cycles weakens its competitiveness in the volumetric energy density and cycle life. Here we report direct graphene growth over silicon nanoparticles without silicon carbide formation. The graphene layers anchored onto the silicon surface accommodate the volume expansion of silicon via a sliding process between adjacent graphene layers. When paired with a commercial lithium cobalt oxide cathode, the silicon carbide-free graphene coating allows the full cell to reach volumetric energy densities of 972 and 700 Wh l(-1) at first and 200th cycle, respectively, 1.8 and 1.5 times higher than those of current commercial lithium-ion batteries. This observation suggests that two-dimensional layered structure of graphene and its silicon carbide-free integration with silicon can serve as a prototype in advancing silicon anodes to commercially viable technology.
citation.title: Silicon carbide-free graphene growth on silicon for lithium-ion battery with high volumetric energy density

news.title: Samsung says that it can double mobile battery life with graphene
news.summary: Samsung has announced that it has successfully doubled the capacity of the Li-ion batteries used in modern electronics such as mobile phones, tablets and laptops. It is achieved by using a new composite material in the cathodes, made of graphene.
